It's the 1st day of #LondonRiversWeek & it's #WorldFishMigrationDay! üêü Man-made barriers e.g. dams make the journey of migratory fish trickier. Preventing migration can be catastrophic for threatened species like the European eel.
https://t.co/siQZitPzaw
Credit: @ThamesEstPart https://t.co/Vqmmc3LONa

@oliverpitt @EnvAgency Believe it or not but, according to the data I have in front of me, @wessexwater wouldn't win, not even close.

Top of league Division 1. @YorkshireWater with a whopping 616,643 hours worth of sewage dumped into rivers in 2019 followed by @stwater with a hefty 272,518 hours.

@HCRCMary @SurreyFRS @ResiAssociation @MoleseySteve @KingstonRUG @MariaHerlihyEA Thank for your tweet. Please report this to our incident line on 0800 80 70 60, so we can get some more information from you.

The UK has made a breakthrough in using science to tackle #coronavirus.  

Scientists can now use sewage to detect local outbreaks, even when people don't show symptoms.  

Find out more: https://t.co/JEJxbjIMR0 

#CovidSewageTesting @DHSCgovuk @EnvAgency https://t.co/vW5ratcTmN

tweets.text:
On #WorldFishMigrationDay we're thrilled to present a film of the recent Bevere #FishPass Opening #JourneyUpTheSevern #StepUpForFish 
Partners: @CanalRiverTrust @severnrivers @EnvAgencyMids @NaturalEngland Funders: @HeritageFundUK @LIFEprogramme #JourneyUpTheSevern #RiverSevern https://t.co/GVr3YwgOjp

We planned #electrofishing monitoring of Bradford Beck #fishpassage easements as part of #WorldFishMigrationDay events but had to run it earlier in the year. The first results are in #WTTBlog https://t.co/IZEnqKuX0D
@WildTroutTrust @BradfordsBecks @EnvAgencyYNE  @fishmigration https://t.co/saaDZna2N2

Making the impassable, passable - part 2! Upgraded culvert allowing fish passage to 500m of upstream spawning habitat, while maintaining farm access. üêü Part of a major #WEG natural flood management project in the Glenderamackin catchment. #WorldFishMigrationDay @EnvAgencyNW https://t.co/SONHz3l37k

Our 3rd project to celebrate #WorldFishMigrationDay is the partial removal of a weir at LongPreston.The weir is no longer needed allowing us to remove the central 60%.At 0.5m high the weir was passable to most fish but was negatively impacting sediment movement &spawning habitats https://t.co/NpCMTb54XZ

Nature-based solutions on @WoodlandTrust Bolton #SmithillsEstate delivering for nature and #BigClimateFightback in #NorthernForest. Great p‚Äôship work @EnvAgency @merseyforest @RibbleTrust @HeritageFundUK  @EmmaHowardBoyd @AndyBurnhamGM @DrewBennellick @ZacGoldsmith @pow_rebecca https://t.co/I9N8X6q7ZH

This #WorldFishMigrationDay we‚Äôre celebrating Unlocking the Severn ‚Äì a project opening 250km of river to migratory fish with fish passes like this one in Bevere

Read more: https://t.co/PdIlQm6GCe
@canalrivertrust @severnunblocked

üì∑https://t.co/ORm20eBUo2 #StepUpForFish https://t.co/RDMqX6T92x

With the support of a range of partners over the last decade we have delivered over 60 fish passage projects, proud to celebrate #WorldFishMigrationDay our wonderful #fish and #rivers @EnvAgencyNW @HeritageFundNOR @theriverstrust @LancsEnvFund @mhclg @The_MMO https://t.co/GQIxBicIEw

Despite a challenging year, barriers to fish migration are still being tackled. Slitting Mill weir has been removed as part of the HLF Hidden Rivers Secret Streams project, led by Don Catchment Rivers Trust. This area of the project was funded via the Rotherham Rivers ll project. https://t.co/f2LM0VK5ug

tweets.text: Today is #WorldFishMigrationDay üåçüêü We want to show our support for those plucky migratory fish and the people helping conserve our rivers! #StepUpForFish #FishMigration #RiverSevern #FollowTheShad @SevernUnlocked @CanalRiverTrust @severnrivers @EnvAgencyMids @NaturalEngland https://t.co/qrBTNiMfm7

RCT are today down at Lydney Lake as part of Rural Crime week - engaging with Local fishermen and encouraging the public to report wildlife crime , in particular Fish Poaching@AnglingTrust @fishery_watch @EnvAgency  üé£üéè https://t.co/bONbs0bf4L

tweets.text: Hatchford Brook re-naturalisation project in Elmdon Park progressing well. Concrete bed and sides removed. Gravels and cobbles added. Just spotted a kingfisher, x2 grey wagtails and a little egret  @Team4Nature @LoveSolihull @ElmdonPark @EnvAgencyMids @SolihullCouncil https://t.co/wXF7R2wkj9

Our Culm grassland project has started its winter works, clearing scrub at Stowford Moor Commons. Here they are with some wonderful volunteers in the sunshine!
#CulmGrassland @Interreg2Seas @DevonCC @EnvAgency. https://t.co/gIznahKP5u
Catch our very own #TwaiteShad expert @charlescrundwe1 on this podcast for #WorldFishMigrationDay We hope it inspires you to #StepUpForFish @severnrivers @EnvAgencyMids https://t.co/Wyw7LG1aP9

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency @MPGeorgeEustice @ZacGoldsmith @pow_rebecca We entrust these people to protect our countryside & nature but they seem more interested in making a profit. Meanwhile our streams, rivers & waterways are getting polluted, fish die but they don't give a damn.

tweets.text: The @EnvAgencyMids Boston #HavenBanks Improvement Scheme is getting winter ready. So far, progress on the project includes building up the core section of the banks with clay & adding new topsoil, & spreading grass seed for over 5km from the #BostonBarrier down to the Wash. https://t.co/tdpONgVgae

Our scientists have made a breakthrough in supporting the UK‚Äôs response to #coronavirus.

We can now use sewage samples provided by water companies to detect local outbreaks, even when people don‚Äôt show symptoms.

Read more: https://t.co/VlvDhIA8I9

#CovidSewageTesting #TeamEA https://t.co/rhsdlZLGYE
